wizard

Class WizardDemo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
      • wizard.WizardDemo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard

    public class WizardDemo
extends org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
    WizardDemo

    Instantiates, houses, and serves up custom WizardPages.

    Author:
    William Lake
    See Also:
    Eclipse API, JFace Wizard

      • addPages

        public void addPages()
        Instantiates all custom Wizard Pages, adding them to the Wizard.
        Specified by:
        addPages in interface org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard
        Overrides:
        addPages in class org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard

      • getNextPage

        public org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizardPage getNextPage(org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizardPage currentPage)
        Serves up the next page in the wizard. If this method is not overridden, the order of pages being served up will mirror the order they were added in the addPages() method via addPage(). Otherwise, you can use custom logic here to determine which of the added pages will be served up next.
        Specified by:
        getNextPage in interface org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard
        Overrides:
        getNextPage in class org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
        Parameters:
        currentPage - The current Wizard page being displayed.
        Returns:
        The next WizardPage to be served up.

      • canFinish

        public boolean canFinish()
        Determines whether the "Finish" button is enabled in the wizard. If not overridden, the Finish button will become enabled when each WizardPage is marked as finished via their individual markPageComplete() methods. E.g. markPageComplete(true) Otherwise you can insert custom logic here to determine when the WizardPage can finish.
        Specified by:
        canFinish in interface org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard
        Overrides:
        canFinish in class org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
        Returns:
        True if the wizard can finish.

      • performFinish

        public boolean performFinish()
        Performs the tasks within the method after the "Finish" button is pressed, but before closing the Wizard. If True is returned, the Wizard will close.
        Specified by:
        performFinish in interface org.eclipse.jface.wizard.IWizard
        Specified by:
        performFinish in class org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard
        Returns:
        True if the Wizard is allowed to close.
